intro: Aphelandra crauca, commonly known as the golden flame plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Acanthaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking, elongated leaves and vibrant, orange-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Aphelandra crauca thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistent moisture to maintain its lush appearance. It is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
